GenMuon

SOME DESCRIPTION HERE…

class dtpr.particles.gen_muon.GenMuon(igm, ev=None, pt=None, eta=None, phi=None, charge=None)[source]
__init__(igm, ev=None, pt=None, eta=None, phi=None, charge=None)[source]

Initialize a Generator Level Muon instance.

Parameters:

  • igm (int) – The index of the generator muon.

  • ev (optional) – The root event object containing event data.

  • pt (float, optional) – The transverse momentum.

  • eta (float, optional) – The pseudorapidity.

  • phi (float, optional) – The azimuthal angle.

  • charge (int, optional) – The charge of the muon.

__str__(indentLevel=0)[source]

Generate a string representation of the Generator Level Muon instance.

Parameters:

indentLevel (int) – The indentation level for the summary.

Returns:

The generator muon summary.

Return type:

str

Add a matched segment to the muon.

Parameters:

seg (Segment) – The segment to add.

did_shower()[source]

Check if the muon showered.

Returns:

True if the muon showered, False otherwise.

Return type:

get_dphi_segments()[source]

Compute the dPhi of the segments of two adjacent stations that match to the generator muon.

Returns:

A list of dPhi values.

Return type:

list

match_segment(seg, max_dPhi, max_dEta)[source]

Check which matching criteria the muon satisfies with a given segment.

Parameters:

  • max_dPhi (float) – The maximum dPhi for matching.

  • max_dEta (float) – The maximum dEta for matching.
